comments:
3.2 M6

I frequently use the switch workspace feature to restart Eclipse. During the shutdown phase, I often see many runtime exceptions (message: "Widget disposed too early") being logged (see stack trace below for an example).

Note that we are running our own product on top of Eclipse 3.2M6. However, there is only Eclipse code in the stack traces. If the problem is caused by a bug in our product, what kind of mistake should we be looking for?

See also: bug 138389.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.workbench 4 0 2006-04-27 13:54:46.640
!MESSAGE Widget disposed too early!
!STACK 0
java.lang.RuntimeException: Widget disposed too early!

Should have waited a little longer. We isolated the problem and it seems to only happen when one of our views is showing during shutdown or restart. Feel free to resolve as you see fit.

This kind of trace often happens if there's a NPE or other error thrown as part of closing or talking to the view during closing.

PW
